full_text:
Case 1:20-cr-00330-AJN Document 763 Filed 08/10/22 Page 65 of 197
LCHVMAX2 Young - direct
1 A. Yes.
2 Q. Anything about what he said that you disagree with?
3 A. No. We try to take notes as accurately as possible and then put them into a 302 document.
4 
5 Q. Okay. And that's what you did in connection with this case as well, correct?
6 
7 A. Yes.
8 Q. So in some cases, at least as I understand it, you physically took the notes and then typed up the 302 later; is that right?
9 
10 A. Yes. Sometimes I took the notes, sometimes my partner took the notes.
11 
12 Q. And your partner is Detective Byrnes?
13 
14 A. Yes.
15 Q. And when one or the other of you takes the notes, do you check the other's work?
16 
17 A. We will both review the 302 before it's finalized and sign off on it.
18 
19 Q. And so in this case, I think you just heard Ms. Comey's question to Special Agent Young, these are not meant to be transcripts of the interviews, right?
20 
21 A. No, they are not.
22 
23 Q. It's a summary of what the witness said?
24 A. Yes.
25 Q. An accurate summary of what the witness said?
SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300
DOJ-OGR-00016794
